alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 4:52AM PDT until August 21 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Inyo County in south central California... * Until 900 AM PDT. * At 452 AM PDT, While rainfall has begun to taper off around Death Valley National Park...Excessive runoff continues and dangerous flash flooding remains possible. Local roadways are washed out in some areas and flood danger will linger into the morning so the warning has been extended until 9 am. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Furnace Creek, Stovepipe Wells, Shoshone, Texas Springs Campground, Panamint Springs, Death Valley Junction, Darwin and Tecopa. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
